Class ReadAndSortApp

java.lang.Object
readandsort.app.ReadAndSortApp
public class ReadAndSortApp extends Object
The ReadAndSortApp class serves as the application controller in related read-and-sort workflows.

It coordinates user inputs, string parsing(StringToListParser), list sorting(CollectionSorter) with specific prompt and delimiter as configuration. It also displays output using the Message utility.

This class is designed for flexibility and reuse. Regardless of prompt message, delimiter(space, comma, asterisk, period...), or sorting logic (LinkedListSorter(existing), StackSorter(future), ArrayListSorter(future)) as provided by SorterFactory, the main logic remains unchanged.

Since:
Week 4 of CSC6301
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Huihua Huang

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run(CollectionSorter sorter, StringToListParser converter)
      Runs a read-and-sort workflow to get sorted integer lists into a collection structure from user input.

      The process as below:
      Ask user for input.
      Split and parse raw string into an unsorted LinkedList.
      Sort this LinkedList into any form of collection structure based on provided sorter.
      Print the result message and list.

      Parameters:
      sorter - an implementation of CollectionSorter that defines the sorting logic and the type of collection to return.
      converter - an object of StringToListParser to parse string into an unsorted LinkedList.

    • askInput

      private void askInput()
      Prompts user continuously until non-empty input is entered. It warns user to re-enter if the initial input is empty. If the input is non-empty, the scanner stores trimmed input to the userInput attribute for future use.

    • printResult

      private void printResult()
      Prints formatted result with success/warning message, the sorted list and its related collection type if it is successful.
